#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Handle the Empty Feeling After Finishing an Awesome Book
#Text=You 've just shut the back cover to a book that made you weep for the non-existence of fictional characters and their worlds .
#Text=You 've laughed , you 've cried , you 've become seriously emotionally involved , and now you 're left with a void deep in your gut .
#Text=Follow these steps to deal with finishing a great book .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Reread it !
#Text=Flip back through the pages , settle in again with that wonderful book smell , and relive the experience .
#Text=If you 're not ready for that type of commitment , just rifle back through to your favorite passages , the best descriptions , or the most entertaining dialogues .
#Text=Highlight or sticky-note your favorites to make it easier the next time the mood strikes .
#Text=Or better yet , copy down quotes or passages into a journal for future enjoyment .
#Text=You 'll thank yourself later .
#Text=Check out other books by the same author or of the same genre .
#Text=If you love the book , chances are you 're also in love with the author 's writing style .
#Text=Check the first few or last pages of your book for other works by that author , or do a quick Internet search .
#Text=On the other hand , maybe it 's the author 's debut novel , or maybe you want something a little different .
#Text=Try looking for books of the same or similar genre -- you might just find your next favorite .
#Text=Participate in online forums !
#Text=You 're probably not the only person having a love affair with your book .
#Text=Go online and search for forums centered around your title .
#Text=People are passionate when they care about something ; you might find that just reading or talking about it will bring the good feelings back !
#Text=Enjoy fan-made creations !
#Text=There are some amazingly talented and undiscovered authors & artists out there -- go find them !
#Text=Visit one of the many fan-fiction sites and you 're bound to find a few or a few hundred stories inspired by your favorite literature .
#Text=This is a good way to get a taste for something that may have faded to black or was outside of a character 's POV in the book itself .
#Text=Absorb the eye candy that is fan art .
#Text=There 's a lot of museum-worthy artwork floating around inspired by books .
#Text=It 's a breath of fresh air seeing other people 's interpretations of something you both obviously enjoyed .
#Text=Head straight to YouTube .
#Text=Fan-made videos inspired by novels are a must , and set to music , you may find some cool new songs along the way .
#Text=Make some of your own art or write stories !
#Text=You do n't have to be a master of your craft .
#Text=After all , this is for you !
#Text=Nobody else has to see your fan art or fan-fiction if you do n't want anyone to .
#Text=Wait for the movie .
#Text=In all honesty , what truly fantastic book is not made into a movie these days ?
#Text=Spend the time in between pondering what scenes might make it to the big screen , where it might be filmed , or who could be cast in your favorite roles .
#Text=Do something else to fill the void !
#Text=If all else fails , occupy yourself .
#Text=The emptiness will fade with time .
#Text=Season permitting , here are a few suggestions :
#Text=Go to the beach
#Text=Learn to skateboard
#Text=Bake a cake
#Text=Tour the Crayola factory
#Text=Build a snowman
#Text=Go to the gym
#Text=Play a sport
